description: Blackburn Rovers offer new deals to defender Danny Batth and forwards Tyrhys Dolan and Andi Weimann.
title: Blackburn Rovers offer deals to Danny Batth, Tyrhys Dolan & Andi Weimann
title_page: Blackburn Rovers offer deals to Danny Batth, Tyrhys Dolan & Andi Weimann - BBC Sport
maintext:
Blackburn Rovers have offered new deals to defender Danny Batth and forwards Tyrhys Dolan and Andi Weimann.
Batth, 34, signed a one-year contract in August last year and scored two goals in 37 league appearances for the Championship side this season.
Dolan, 23, has made 211 appearances for Blackburn after joining in 2020, while Weimann, 33, who also joined as a free agent last August, scored seven goals in 30 league games this campaign.
The club have also triggered the one-year option on the contract of winger Ryan Hedges, 29.
Forwards Dilan Markandy, 23, and Jack Vale, 24, have both been released, while veteran midfielder Adam Forshaw, 33, has not been offered a new deal but the club have said they will "keep in close contact" with him over the summer.
Valerien Ismael's side finished seventh this season, two points off the play-off places.
